long_description:
Rocky hillsides, panoramic views of towering redwood and oak trees, rows of vineyards as far as the eye can see - you don’t have to be a mountaineer to enjoy Napa Valley hikes. Save your breath with these breathtaking views. For gorgeous Napa Valley sights without trekking uphill, here are the best no-incline wine country hikes.

 

Napa River Trail

Take the 3.8-mile loop southbound away from downtown Napa along the Napa River. The Napa River Trail is accessible year-round and is a great place to view the calm waterway and waterfowl as you make your way through Kennedy Park before looping back north. Consider packing a picnic on this hike, as the 350-acre park has various picnic areas, fresh air, gorgeous scenery, and outdoor recreational games you’ll want to take your time with. 2295 Streblow Dr, Napa

 

[5 Dog-Friendly Hiking Trails in Napa Valley]

 

Trancas Crossing Park Loop

Within Trancas Crossing Park north of downtown Napa is a moderate 0.7-mile loop perfect for a stroll along the Napa River western bank. Escape the bustling of downtown Napa for a pleasant walk on this paved surface. The station attendants are friendly and the views of the surrounding hills and wetlands are a perfect spot to observe native wildlife. 610 Trancas St, Napa

 

Napa River Ecological Reserve Loop

The 1.3-mile loop trail will take you to the river, where if the water level is low enough, you can cross and stroll the quiet trail. Observe valley oak and wild plum trees and other native plants like snowberry, Himalaya berry, and wild rose. Hikers have seen many bird species, busy bees hard at work in a hive, and migrant juvenile steelheads making their way downstream in the spring. Napa River Ecological Reserve, Yountville

 

[3 Waterfall Hikes in Napa Valley]

 

Petrified Forest Loop

This 0.4-mile loop trail will take you through an ancient forest rich in geological history. The educational walk will lead past petrified trees, ancient ash flows, and a view of the volcano that created it all. Tucked up into the Mayacamas Mountains west of Calistoga, this dog-friendly trail is lined with beautiful wildflowers and only has a gain of 68 feet in elevation. 4100 Petrified Forest Rd, Calistoga

 

 

Ready for a hiking challenge? Check out our guide to Stunning Napa Valley Summit Hikes Worth Trekking, for unbelievable views and serious elevation gain.

 

--

 

After a day exploring Napa Valley’s natural beauty, retire to the Wine Country Inn, a luxury boutique hotel in the heart of wine country. Unwind from the day with a complimentary wine reception featuring a local vintner, held every Friday and Saturday evening.
